Sentencas: The alpha-NaFeO2 structure-type oxides, such as LiNiO2, LiCoO2, and alpha-LiAlO2, could not only provide channels for Li+ conduction but also conduct protons through intercalation.
Titulo: Interlayer Conducting Mechanism in α-LiAlO2 Enables Fast Proton Transport with Low Activation Energy for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: However, the detailed conduction mechanism of protons in the layer structure oxide needs to be further distinguished.
Titulo: Interlayer Conducting Mechanism in α-LiAlO2 Enables Fast Proton Transport with Low Activation Energy for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: In this work, we prepared layered-oxide alpha-Li0.88AlO2 and used it as an electrolyte to assemble a solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC), which delivered an output of 1046 mW cm-2 at 550 degrees C, a decent power output is ascribed to the excellent ion conductivity (0.2 S cm-1) and low activation energy (0.36 eV) of the alpha-Li0.88AlO2 electrolyte.
Titulo: Interlayer Conducting Mechanism in α-LiAlO2 Enables Fast Proton Transport with Low Activation Energy for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Moreover, the H/ D isotope experiments revealed that the proton dominated the ion conduction of alpha-Li0.88AlO2.
Titulo: Interlayer Conducting Mechanism in α-LiAlO2 Enables Fast Proton Transport with Low Activation Energy for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: First-principles calculations indicate that the special structure-layered oxides provide channels that allow protons to transfer rapidly with low activation energy.
Titulo: Interlayer Conducting Mechanism in α-LiAlO2 Enables Fast Proton Transport with Low Activation Energy for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: This work indicates the possibility of using layered oxides as proton conductors in a low-temperature SOFC (LT-SOFC) and reveals the proton transport mechanism in oxides, it provides a new approach to exploit novel electrolytes for LT-SOFC.
Titulo: Interlayer Conducting Mechanism in α-LiAlO2 Enables Fast Proton Transport with Low Activation Energy for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells
